Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run home run in the ninth inning to put the Mets ahead 3-2.
The Mets added another run to win 4-2 against the Brewers.
Brewers hit back-to-back home runs in the bottom of the seventh inning to take a 2-0 lead.
Pre-Game Insights: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza predicted a big hit was coming for Alonso in his postgame interview after the Mets' Game 2 loss.
Post-Match Reflections: Carlos Mendoza expressed confidence in the fans' support and urged them to continue believing in the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game featured a pitcher's duel between Jose Quintana and Tobias Myers, with both pitchers allowing no runs in their respective innings.
Jose Butto, who had been one of the Mets' strongest relievers, struggled in this game, allowing back-to-back home runs.
